page.title: 09THORNHILL LISTED BUILDINGS
page.content: A "listed" building is a building which you can not knock down or alter in any way without permission. In Thornhill there are eight of these. There are three different categories - national importance, regional interest and local interest. In Thornhill there are four of regional interest, four of local interest but none of national importance. The "listed" buildings are:Nos.29,31,35,37,39,101 Main Street, (no.29 is a pub and no.31 is the lounge; no. 35 is a byre behind no.33; nos.37/39 are an antique shop), the 'Lion and Unicorn' Hotel and the large white building at the top of the Kippen road.
